intro: Delima laevis, commonly known as the smooth delima, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, demonstrating a high degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Delima laevis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
